In accordance -with the decision come to on 10th June (Cabinet 32(31) Conclusion 13) I have conferred with the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries, the Secretary of State for Scotland, the Lord Privy Seal and a representative of the Chancellor of the Exchequer. - '2. Subject to the approval of the Chancellor of the Exchequer (whose representative was vrnable to agree) the Ministers present agreed to recommend the adoption of the scheme submitted in Appendix a to my memorandum C.P.143(31) subject to the following alteration:-Paragraph 3(1) - A limit of five pence per head of population to be substituted for four pence per head of population in the first condition to be satisfied by rural district councils who are eligible to make applications for special assistance. 3, The Minister of Agriculture was anxious that the additional assistance under the scheme should be availaole to necessitous rural district councils in respect of houses for agricultural workers not only in agricultural parishes as defined by section 60 of the Housing Act, 1930, but also in non-agricultural parishes. As, however, it is understood that the Chancellor of the Exchequer is not prepared to agree to any extension outside agricultural parishes, ho modification of the scheme in this respect.is proposed.(Intld.) A.G. .June 18th, 1931.
